column5: Great day on the Bog for sure but you know the winds bad when you get those kinda white caps in that body of water.
Yah...he is a great guy Roger!!
Great day on the water Wayne!! Lew does a great job of netting fish!!
some nice torpedoes there guys I guess they dont get to fat in the fall on the bog?  Wayne when you comin here to look at my plane I know where the water is
5 in a day?! It's taken me all season to get 4.....sheesh. Nicely done though, pretty cool the difference in colour and pattern between the last two you guys caught.
Nice job guys, congrats on the good day.
Five aint bad for one day i guess.  But did you see any MONSTERS?   WTG.  I was at work and now i am jealous.

Nice Musky Fishing Trip/Report !!!!!!!!   well done there musky wayne...LOL..LOL  sounds like you sure had their number dialed in on the BOG !!! thats real good shootin for only a few hours on the water,and great pics too...man i fish there alot and you see that shallow lake with waves like that man its windy thats for sure.  ..they said wind gusts to 85kph at lindsay airport,and thats just afew miles up the lake....i wonder how come all those fish had that lympysarcoma,on them????   i thought they got that mostly around spawning time??? it makes you wonder that a few of your fish were marked badly whats the rest of the muskies in the lake look like ???   does anyone know why ?? thanks for the report,and thats ok lew ,next time maybe you will boat a 50"er.....     cheers

I don't know why they had it so bad Shawn..but one was pretty damn gross. The whole side was raw, head to tail, and she bled ALL over the boat during the quick single picture shot after lifing her out of the net.
Gonna fire up your own forum too bud ?
Wow awesome report Wayne! Looks like a great time was had by you two. Did you take the horseshoe outta your boat. LOL. Cheers.
No I left it hidden up under the gunnel for BOQ in 13 days!
WTG Guys sweet day out on the BOG !! Nice SKI's too..
Nice outing.  A great ending to a season on the water.
For sure Connie...I'd be happy to end the season there...but we're not! Lots of soft water fishing left yet!
It's not over yet TG, we've still got 6 weeks of musky fish'n to go up here
Whoops.  Good luck.
That's an awesome day on the water if you ask me.  CONGRATS and thanks for the report.

I've had a guy bugging me for about a month to go over to Caesera to look at his wind damaged float plane. Was reluctant..since I don't get paid to do quotes, but then a light bulb went off ! Float planes = water = water access = ramp..... so I made it worth the trip and took the boat early this morning for the 2.5 hr drive.    Arranged for Lew to meet up with me, after I was done going over this floatplane...and we were told we could launch right at the float base. Well I quickly looked over the damaged airplane,    got rid of the prospective customer and then found we couldn't launch there as it was WAY too shallow as far out as we could see. Lew said he saw a ramp at the village pier and off we went. Not a bad ramp...had some issues getting the boat back on straight..but we managed. Off we went and I now fully understand why they call it the bog. Pretty choppy as we headed out...and it only got worse as the day went on with gusts on the ++ side of 50K    Didn't take us very long to find the first one...just a touch over 37" long. Cancer growth -lympysarcoma - on it that was pretty clean compared to others to come.      Lew supplied us a good lunch and I allowed him to eat his fully while I reeled in a few more fish ! LOL    Think this one was a twin to the 37. This one's right side was an absolute mess and bleeding sores etc.    It continued to get rougher...that ain't rain on the windshield.    This guy was just shy of 42"     After it, and about 3 boat lengths forward of releasing it.....I water released another 36 to 38 " fish without the net. Just flipped the hook out while standing on the boarding platform.  Starting to get a tad rough...starting to look like Georgian Bay back on Sunday!    ..and a short time later I get another one for a total of five muskie for the day for me!!    Now at this point I'm feelin bad for Lew...we even ran the same bait...same colour for quite some time and nodda for him. I took a break and he changed up hooks on the way back and within 10 seconds put this one in the boat to complete the day.    What a GREAT way to mix business with pleasure, and who better to spend a day on the water with than Lew. Great guy and great company in the boat. Thanks for getting out there with me Lew and making a complete day out of my floatplane inspection on Scugog. Drove the 2.5hrs home...just backed the uncovered boat in the hangar and it started to POUR 2 minutes later. Perfect timing, after a perfect day.  Wayne
Nice haul guys! WTG!!  Sinker
I "almost" see a smile there on Lew... but it seems to be upside down!  LOL!  Sounds like an awesome day on the water thanks for the post!...  Ger.  PS... Where are the steeples?
Wow, take a look at you Wayne, the musky pro  Want your net back, I think its jinxed  Nice fish you two.  Joey

LOL Joey...it was the last boat that was jinxed ! I had the stowmaster net last year and it didn't help in that boat. You'll be fine with the Frabil ....  Maybe I need to change my handle to Muskie Wayne...so I can join my bud Muskie Dan. Take the guy on a charter...catch him a fish and his head swells ! LOL
wow,what a great day and congrats

Twas a fun trip indeed Wayne and you definetely had the hot bait for the day.      At one point, I was cleaning weeds off my bait and you got a fish, then released it and got the next one before I even got back in the water  It was Waynes 1st time on the bog and only a couple times for me, but I think we were both surprised at how rough that little lake became after the winds really started to build in the afternoon. The weeds were unbelievably thick too, everywhere,  and I think we spent more time cleaning baits than fishing them. Still very healthy though, bright green and plenty of places to hold fish.  Don't know where all the fishermen were though, we spent 8 hours out there and saw a grand total of 2 other boats.....ya gotta luv that !!  Thanks again Musky Wayne, it was a blast, I always enjoy fishing with you, and  anytime your lookin to mix up a bit of business & pleasure again, just gimme a call.
....Oh my, I'm speechless.
Good job boys!
great report    that's a good day of muskie fishing
Wha choo talkin bout Willis? Dont you know its the de rigeur thing to do?
Wayne great report. Lew,look whos calling the ketle black. Smile.  Now as far as that plane repair. Heck a strong roll of shiney duct tape,and she be as good as new.Heck even I can do that.LOL
looks like a great day and some nice fish  rob
Attaboy guys.   A little business and a whole lot of fishing - a great balance.
nice report .  Wayne the Muskie hunter   strikes again. Maybe I need a new boat  TB
Congrats Lew and Muskie Wayne,looks like the parade was in town Blew like a bus load of Fairies

You found a way to turn a non paying estimate into something profitable  Congratulations! It's always good to figure out a way to do that, the one thing I don't care for is running around the countryside for no pay and giving free estimates when it's my gas, time and wear and tear.  Both Lew and you saw this opportunity and lunged for it. Except for the weather it was as close to a perfect day as you could have hoped for...well maybe not so hot for Lew   LOL. Next time luck will be on Lew's side.

Great job out there guys!  And you're welcome Wayne...not that Bly and I had any real chance of a muskie on Monday...LOL.  I was trying to make sure I didn't sink the boat and I almost did that...haha.  It's good to see that lake produce...it'll probably be our home lake for a while...it's the closest lake to us and very convenient.  We'll venture to others I'm sure as well.  Some nice looking muskies there...congrats to the two of you!
Wow 6 muskie in one day! Unbelievable!  As for that last pic.......I've never seen anyone so unhappy to catch a muskie!
great report guys!

And the hits just keep on coming!  Congrats on a great day on the water fellas.  Wayne knowing Lew I can almost bet he didn't mind you out scoring him  Karma strikes again.  Free estimates Wayne.... thay's what I do best anymore   Cheers

Very nice...and outfished Lew on Musky to boot!  (That has to be some kind of record no?)  Gotta love how the windshield keeps all that spray off of you and the gear...such a sweet ride Wayne  Some great results on a pretty crumby day, weather-wise, nice fish! Tony

Thanks everyone and Tony...can' t beat a full windshield for sure!  As for Lew's lack of smile...well after 8 hours of being wind beaten, what can ya say. Thanks goodness it was 14*C as it felt like zero at times.

What a great day!  Two class acts on the water together. You are becoming a Musky Master Wayne.  That boat sure helped out on a wavy day like that. Nice of you to back off for the day and give the kid a chance Lew
great report!  Looks like a fun day.  THose muskies on ther bog sure are skinny compared to most musky this time of year.  Cheers!
